text1:
The Lilim is a dedicated missile destroyer designed to provide a mobile platform for missile fire support. Being much more sluggish compared to other hulls of its size, the Lilim-class serves a great escort role as the hammer against the anvil. Despite the ship's great performance as a support platform, it is rarely used in the post-Collapse sector due to the ship's overbearing maintenance costs.

The profound Lilim-class was built by the Tri-Tachyon Corporation as a response to the deployment of the Gryphon-class series of ships designed by Altair Exotech. Noticing the Gryphon's effectiveness as a support ship in fleet engagements, it was decided that a new series of ships specializing on missile support were to be designed and constructed. Being the result of this program, the Lilim-class has almost no armaments besides its four missile slots. This allows the ship to serve a dedicated missile support role; from providing long range support behind the frontlines to escorting capital ships and delivering finishing blows on enemy hulls.

The Lilith is a dedicated missile cruiser designed to provide a mobile platform for heavy missile fire support. The hull-integrated missile nanoforge ensures that the ship can replenish missile armaments. Being much more bulky compared to other hulls of its size, the Lilith-class serves a great escort role as the hammer against the anvil. Despite the ship's great performance as a support platform, it is rarely used in the post-Collapse sector due to the ship's overbearing maintenance costs.

The mighty Lilith-class was built by the Tri-Tachyon Corporation as a response to the deployment of the Gryphon-class series of ships designed by Altair Exotech. Noticing the Gryphon's effectiveness as a support ship in fleet engagements, it was decided that a new series of ships specializing on missile support were to be designed and constructed. Being the result of this program, the Lilith-class has almost no other armaments besides the many missile mounts the ship. Of particular interest is the addition of a Paladin Point Defense built into the hull. This allows the ship to serve a dedicated missile support role; from providing long range support behind the frontlines to escorting capital ships and delivering finishing blows on enemy hulls, while also providing point defense support from missiles and fighters launched from enemy forces.

The Brynhildr, an ancient missile cruiser, embodies resilience through its sturdy construction, foregoing modern shielding technology. Instead, the Brynhildr relies on an integrated Damper Field, utilizing archaic design principles meticulously adapted to contemporary standards. This remarkable adaptation enables the Brynhildr to withstand what would otherwise be devastating damage during intense combat encounters.

Wrapped in an enigmatic shroud of mystery, the Brynhildr's origins remain largely obscure. It was retired from active service alongside the early iterations of the formidable Onslaught battleship. Evolving doctrines within the Domain Navy, coupled with the ship's relatively high maintenance costs at the time, rendered it impractical for continued fleet utilization. However, in the tumultuous post-collapse sector, the Brynhildr-class vessels have been brought back to service and have proven their mettle as formidable missile support platforms.
notes: construction, an integrated missile autoforge, and no modern shields. Instead, the Brynhildr is equipped with an integrated Damper Field of archaic design but tuned to modern standards. This allows the Brynhildr to allocate 100% of flux buildup to weapon systems, leaving defense to its heavy armor enhanced by the obscure physics of resonant field-dampening.

text1:
A favorite of pirates and private armies due to the missile support it can provide along with its non-demanding support profile, the ancient Tartarus-class frigates pack a respectable amount of missile firepower. The ship's suprising agility allows a wise commander to shift missile support to wherever it is needed.

This design is old enough to be contemporary with early models of the Onslaught battleship, though unlike that illustrious pillar of the Domain Navy, the Ko Combine m225 "Tartarus" was never intended to be a frontline combat ship. It was originally designed as a cheap and affordable ship to assist in mining operations. After the collapse of the Gate network however these ships were fitted with missile armaments and became the favourite of independent captains for the ship's non-demanding support profile.

The Adramelech is a rare, experimental cruiser designed for mine-laying operations. Significant amount of hull space is dedicated to assembly lines for the production of large, bulky phase mines that the ship can deploy during combat. This allows the Adramelech to support allied ships with strategic mine deployments even during extended deployments. The ship also has a small nanoforge dedicated to the production of smaller proximity mines which can be launched from the two Proximity Charge Cannons built into the hull.

While the Adramelech boasts remarkable utility in strategic mine deployment, its substantial upkeep costs and relatively niche role limits its widespread deployment within fleets. However, on occasion, discerning captains may encounter this vessel acting as a formidable heavy escort for Tri-Tachyon flagships or, in more exceptional circumstances, under the command of enterprising mercenaries.
Teleports a heavy strike mine to the target area. The mine will slowly track nearby enemy ships and explode a few seconds after its proximity trigger is activated.

The Whiskey Pete is a drone carrier designed to lead civilian mining operations. Featuring no modular fighter bays, the ship instead includes an array of drones designed to assist in cracking open asteroids which have been modified in cycles post-Collapse to assist during combat situations as well. Nonetheless, the Whiskey Pete is not a combat ship and works bests as a support ship behind the frontlines.

The Ko Combine M650-R was a remarkable ship even before the Collapse of the gate network for the sheer number of auxiliary drones it could support for the ship's size. In the dangerous Post-collapse sector many modification packages have been assembled by various survivalist and pirate groups with the most popular being the one developed by Whiskey "Milkers" Pete, which consists of specifications to up-armour the ship for combat, supercharge factory-spec systems and replace the outdated drones with more modern SEx Co. designs. The Whiskey Pete modification is revered by many privateers for the revolutionary design of its huge titanium nano-alloy frontal fuel containers with distinctive voluminous figure. While some may appreciate the subtle architecture, in recent history, the heavily shielded tanks offered the means of the reliable smuggling of coveted Eventide spirits, earning the venerable ship its name.
Simple drones fitted with hammer-class torpedoes, designed to assist in mining operations. Fragile and underarmed, these drones rely on support from escort fighter screens to deliver their payload.
Simple mining drones with aftermarket combat modifications that make them somewhat effective in combat, yet still lacking the punch of proper fighter wings.

Quad launcher system capable of launching a devastating torpedo barrage. the Quadruple Giga-class torpedo platform offers a devastating four-launch burst of Giga-class torpedoes, but is held back by its hefty logistical profile and a disappointing damage potential during extended deployments due to a limited magazine size.

The Perigee-class vessel is an effective mix of advanced scientific and military technologies, perfect for long-range exploration of hostile space. The ship features relatively accommodating weapon mounts, advanced weapons systems and a great logistical profile. Although flexible, the Perigee usually struggles with dedicated combat vessels of similar size, relegating the ship to mostly support roles.

The ship features a large sensor dome at the front end of the ship which is useful in survey operations and combat encounters alike. Perigee captains are used to operating in small fleets and tend to be an independent, self-reliant lot. The ship can hold its own in one-on-one engagements by smart use of its powerful shield emitter and strong engines. However, its armor rating makes it seem somewhat fragile on paper, and thus it is rarely part of big fleet actions. The high construction costs of the hull typically mean that only affluent tech mining consortiums can afford an Perigee-class vessel that is fully outfitted for an aggressive exploratory role.

Although automated machines of war were forbidden in core Domain space, war drones were quietly employed outside of officially incorporated volume. Frontier garrisons were often bolstered by drone ships, and they were deployed liberally against rebellious worlds to tip the terrible balance of attrition, setting the industrial might of the Domain versus the lives of 'freedom fighters'.

The Stronghold drone is one of the heaviest drones deployed in drone units. Lacking most regular armament the Stronghold instead includes many missile-type weapon mounts to provide unmatched firepower in the few drone units which were expected to face the heaviest of resistance. Not being much more than a support platform meant that the Stronghold drones were anticipated to regularly be disabled in combat, so the heavy drone was designed with highly modular components which allowed badly damaged hulls to be rapidly cannibalized to repair lightly damaged hulls up to combat capacity without the need for shipyard facilities. The Stronghold is rarely seen among drone units due to the simple fact that they were deployed much sparsely compared to other drones.
A torpedo launcher designed to fire Giga-class torpedoes in two-round bursts. Makes up for its limited damage potentional with unmatched strike damage.

A short-range defensive weapon system that fires at an astonishing rate of over a thousand rounds per minute. The rounds from the Mephisto are only effective against projectiles and fighter craft as any ship-grade armor can easily deflect the rounds

A passenger liner from a more civilized age, the Mbaye-Gogol 440 "Starliner" was built to travel between the systems of the Domain in speed and comfort. The Starliner features private first-class cabins, two classes of food service, a zero-G theatre, and even a small landing/launch bay for exclusive use by executive-class passengers. (Being a civilian ship there are, of course, no facilities for fighter repair and rearmament)'.

The Starliner is equipped with a forward shield to ensure passenger safety and protect the hull from routine abrasion. Unlike the common refit seen in the Sector today, this ancient relic has few weapon mounts and an even more fragile base hull. The stronger, pristine armor plating of the ship does very little to help protect its fragile hull.

An unmodified original civilian model before the Mora-class hulls were refitted into carriers, demilitarized variants of the Mora-class are still used by salvage crews and prospectors alike. This class of ship was commissioned during the same period of carrier-centric Domain naval doctrine as the ubiquitous Talon fighter. Armoured to withstand the fury of battle alongside the Onslaught, the Mora was nonetheless decommissioned en masse as doctrine shifted to favour heavier guns and capital ships flanked by line-cruisers. Demilitarized hulls were sold and converted into mobile industrial platforms for use on the frontiers of the Domain. While lacking the formidable weaponry and advanced combat systems of its militarized counterpart, this variant of the Mora-class remains a versatile and reliable vessel sought after by salvage crews and resource prospectors operating in the far reaches of space.

The rugged and eminently adaptable Mora is a common sight in long-range surveying, mining, construction, drone handling, and use as mobile drydocks. Some hulls were even half-buried on alien worlds and used as armoured power-stations and workshops to form the core of new settlements. After the Collapse, many Mora hulls were re-militarized almost suspiciously rapidly by factions that did not possess dedicated fleet carriers although the demilitarized hulls are still used as auxiliaries in the Sector to this day.

Perhaps the magnum opus design of the Orion Shipyards, the Hainuwele-class is able to project vast amounts of firepower through its numerous fighter craft squadrons. When not protected by its fighter wings it never travels alone but instead is at the head of space-borne carrier fleets. These task forces are a rarity, as the power they hold is usually required to subjugate entire planets or blockade enormous areas of space.

The Hainuwele series of hulls were designed by the Orion Shipyards, the corporation behind such designs as the Conquest-class series of ships as well as many former traditional Armada ships. Space Naval tacticians of the day were confident that the mobility required for advanced tactics would always outperform armor and shields and thus were the key to winning an engagement. The result was a formidable battlecarrier, much faster than many capital ships even today, though lacking the heavy armor plating that most capital ships of the time came equipped with.

While most ship-captains are familiar with the modern Drover design of ship - and its troubled development - many captains aren't aware of the earlier designs. The first generation of Drover series of hulls were deployed very briefly in backwater worlds to bolster carrier capacity before they were recalled to be decommissioned as elements in the navy who followed the old Capital-school sent the Drover design back to committee, citing insufficient firepower for the ship weight class to meet standard guidelines. While most of these ships were indeed decommissioned and scrapped, it would seem that not all of them were, as this hull is a prime example of the first generation design of the Drover hull. While the ship was - and is still is - arguably out-of-date even in current Sector standards, its pre-Collapse origin means that the technology within the hull is highly sought-after and is likely to fetch a great price if sold.

Although automated machines of war were forbidden in core Domain space, war drones were quietly employed outside of officially incorporated volume. Frontier garrisons were often bolstered by drone ships, and they were deployed liberally against rebellious worlds to tip the terrible balance of attrition, setting the industrial might of the Domain versus the lives of 'freedom fighters'.

The Embattlement drone is a pure support platform and not much else. Lacking most regular armament the Embattlement instead is equipped with a single, large missile-type weapon mount to provide effective firepower support in drone units which were expected to face a fair bit of resistance. Two heavy plates of ablative armor mounted at the front of the unit allow the drone to take a fair bit of punishment when faced head-on, though the ship's poor mobility leave it vulnerable to flanking.

The Melpomene is a rare, experimental hull developed by the Tri-Tachyon corporation. The ship is infamous for its hull-integrated prototype "Temporal Shell" system and the it's so-called ability to violate the laws of physics. Only a limited run of prototypes has been produced.

Gross causality violating technology was banned by the Domain, and this ban is now upheld by Hegemony doctrine - with Luddic support. Nonetheless, the Tri-Tachyon Corporation funded further research into the field of 'time manipulation' through black projects and clandestine research programs hidden from Domain authorities. The Melpomene's uniquely hull-integrated prototype "Temporal Shell" system, first tested with the Scarab series of hulls, was quickly scaled up and supposedly deployed into two bigger cruiser-sized hulls. While the other, more developed prototype is lost to history after the collapse, the Melpomene-class series of hulls remain in service, and are considered one of the most advanced designs currently available in the Sector.

The Furtive is complete overhaul of the Eagle-class series of combat cruisers. Decommisioned hulls are demilitarized and many systems are removed to make space for additional cargo bays. The conversion process is an involved and complex affair that requires a vast amount of work on the part of a skilled shipwright. The result is a freighter with impressive agility for it's size, but little in terms of offensive capabilities.

The originator of the desing is said to be the owner of an independent salvage firm who was frustrated by the limitations of their existing ships. Many of the freighter designs commonly found throughout the Sector are quite utilitarian in nature. Big, bulky, and slow, they have a tendency to get stuck in bad places. In particular, their low top speed means that they are exceptionally vulnerable when being pursued. As such, the Furtive is a highly maneuverable ship designed specifically to elude pursuit. It is fast enough to escape most pursuers, but also big enough to hold considerable quantities of cargo.

A stealth tug which audaciously employs phase technology to support covert fleet operations, the Spectre is not cheap or efficient. Raised up from a dusty set of databanks hidden in an unnamed rock orbiting a nondescript star for a hundred cycles after the First AI War, the Spectre schematics provided an immense boon to the logistics of Tri-Tachyon raiders during the Second AI War. These fleets were infamously named 'sensor ghosts' as their extensive use of phase technology made them almost invisible to most fleet sensors.

"We were a few days out from port, and this whole fleet of the Tachie sensor ghosts, just appeared out of nowhere.... Just went past us in six hours like it was nothing. Not even our escort frigates could burn that fast." - Commander Kane Gleise, recovered logs from ISS Black Star

An ejector cannon integrated into the ship, designed to launch proximity mines at high velocities. Integrated ordnance assembly facilities on-board the hulls it is mounted in feed the magazines with a constant supply of ammunition for extended deployments.

This is a Starliner hull modified by the militant faithful of the Luddic Path into a fearsome battle cruiser. The passenger decks are collapsed and re-welded to greatly thicken the effective armour of the hull and the ship's former flare launchers have been bastardized into launching canisters of fused flak. Several platforms, ripped from other ships, have been attached to the hull to provide more space for mounting weapons aimed at those who serve Moloch that they may perhaps find absolution in blessed oblivion.

The base Starliner hull, with its many passenger decks, offered vast amounts of space for the militant engineers of the Luddic Path and their approach to ship design can be seen in its full glory with this modification. The forward-facing shield generator has been entirely removed, and in its place, a damper field generator has been added to keep the structure stable when under fire. The old thrusters of the ship, used mostly for maneuvering purposes, have been completely replaced with a capital-grade engine that has been haphazardly modified to operate well beyond its intended range of operation.

A support-oriented high-tech carrier, the Nephilim is the result of the line of thought that 'sometimes the best defense is indeed the best defense'. Significant hull space is dedicated to the ship's 'fortress shield' system which allows the Nephilim to effectively stand against ships of higher tonnage. What the ship lacks in raw firepower it makes up for with its survivability and flexibility.

This is a Mule hull modified by the militant faithful of the Luddic Path into a fearsome combat destroyer. The cargo decks are collapsed and re-welded to thicken the effective armour of the hull while additional turrets have been planted along the hull. A single large weapon mount has been crudely mounted at the front, aimed at those who serve Moloch that they may perhaps find absolution in blessed oblivion.

The Mule-class is a tough nut to crack, which makes its designation as a combat freighter apt. Pirates will often bypass even a lone Mule and go off in search of easier prey.

The Myriad, a relic from the explosive expansion of the Domain, represents a bygone era of unrelenting dominance. As an imposing behemoth, it stood as the ultimate symbol of power, instilling fear and asserting authority over all spacefaring civilizations deemed worthy of conquest. However, the relentless march of military progress rendered its hull obsolete. Its armor design proved incompatible with early shield generators, its crew requirements were staggering, and its targeting systems lacked sophistication. Consequently, the great Domain forges swiftly replaced it with modernized alternatives, such as the Legion-class.

Ages passed, until the Knights of Ludd chanced upon an untainted museum archive on a desolate world. Faced with a moral quandary, a council of inquisitors fiercely debated the line dividing sin from virtue, and the corrupting influence of technology versus righteous craftsmanship. Against the odds, a senior knight-inquisitor with an unusually open mind meticulously studied the archive's contents and successfully convinced the council to indefinitely postpone the order of destruction.

Thus, the vessel was christened the "Myriad," paying homage to the countless fighter decks housed within this war cathedral. No conventional navy would dare deploy such a monstrous ship, but the Church and its Knights could rely on an abundance of devoted volunteer-militants to man the vast array of fighters and rudimentary targeting stations. It stands as a testament to the innumerable faithful who will answer the call to defend their cause.
Fabricates and deploys several defensive drones armed with mining lasers. The drones orbit the ship in a holding pattern.

The Brizo is a remarkable vessel, a hospital ship designed to provide essential medical aid and care for the injured. Trauma teams aboard this specialized vessel work tirelessly to treat and stabilize wounded crew members, ensuring their swift recovery and minimizing the loss of valuable personnel during combat engagements and operational disasters.

With the ever-escalating costs of ship maintenance and the demands of warfare, most authorities find it difficult to justify the financial burden of sustaining a hospital ship. Only the faithful volunteers of the Luddic Church, and the dutiful captains of the Hegemony, operate hospital ships in these troubled times. Its presence symbolizes a rare dedication to humanity in the face of war, transcending political boundaries and affiliations. A reminder that even in the darkest of times, humanity's capacity for empathy endures.
Nimble and delicate auxiliary vessel designed to assist in search and rescue operations. Equipped with minimal armaments to contain disasters and cut up bulkheads during extended operations.

This variant of the renowned Hammerhead hull has undergone significant modifications at the skilled hands of the faithful engineers of the Luddic Path. The most striking alteration to the Hammerhead Mk.II is complete removal of modern shield systems in favor of an Orion Drive affixed to the ship's stern. This radical propulsion system typically reserved for light warships grants the Hammerhead Mk.II unparalleled speed and agility on the battlefield. The ship's newfound ability to quickly reposition itself has proven instrumental in both evading enemy fire and launching swift, devastating attacks.

What sets this particular refit apart is the suspiciously well-made execution of these modifications. The faithful of the Luddic Path, known for their staunch opposition to advanced technology, have typically shown limited expertise in harnessing the full potential of such systems. It leaves observers wondering how a faction so deeply rooted in religious tradition and disdain for high-tech advancements could produce such a refined vessel. It sparks speculation about secret alliances, hidden support from other factions, or even clandestine deals made in the shadows of the sector.

The Eradicator Mk.II is an extraordinary marvel of Luddic Path engineering. Modern shielding systems have been completely ripped out in favor of an archaic damper field, and the now-empty hull space is filled with additional weapon mountings as well as shoddily-integrated flux conduits. These ill-advised modifications would in any other context be considered insane, but it is these very modifications that give the Eradicator Mk.II the sheer firepower to stand up against more conventional ships. The ceremonial symbols etched upon the ship's hull serve as a constant reminder of its faithful purpose.

The additional weapon mounts inadequately integrated into the hull amplify its destructive potential, enabling the Eradicator Mk.II to unleash devastating salvos upon those who serve Moloch that they may perhaps find absolution in blessed oblivion.

A product of radical modifications made to the original Condor hull, this formidable battlecarrier strikes fear into the hearts of its enemies with its distinctive blend of raw power and reckless ingenuity. Weapon mounts have been haphazardly integrated into the hull and the ship's fighter assembly systems have been recklessly overclocked and pushed beyond their designed limits to churn out a relentless swarm of fighters at an incredible speed. These additions lend the ship a rough, patchwork appearance, but don't let its unconventional aesthetics fool you, for within its chaotic exterior lies a deadly arsenal that can rain destruction upon those who serve Moloch that they may perhaps find absolution in blessed oblivion.
"No, that's the cylinder head port. They somehow connected the AM fuel intake to... This 3rd-gen KL exhaust. I didn't even consider that someone would be insane enough to weaponize this stuff."
text2: - Memo recovered from an independent shipyard

text1: Deploys a shaped antimatter charge behind the ship. The explosion applies force to a massive push-plate, which absorbs the shock and spreads the resulting acceleration over a timeframe where it can be handled by the ship's inertial compensators. The ship is briefly propelled forward at a rate very few more "advanced" technologies can hope to match.

The Enforcer Mk. II represents a radical re-engineering of the renowned Enforcer hull at the skilled hands of the faithful engineers of the Luddic Path. An array of hardpoints adorns its resculpted bow, heralding a menacing presence on the battlefield. Misaligned plates of armor grace the ship's exterior. As impressive as the Enforcer Mk. II may be, it bears the unmistakable marks of its haphazard modifications. The design is a precarious balance between enhanced performance and the ever-present risk of catastrophic failure.

The Matron is a marvel of technological ingenuity designed to push the boundaries of drone warfare. An array of autonomous drones equipped orbit the ship in a tight holding pattern, using barely legal delta-level AI subsystems to maintain a perfect defensive perimeter around the ship.  In the event that a drone gets destroyed, the formation immediately shifts to maintain optimal defensive coverage. The drones operate as an extension of the ship's formidable arsenal, providing a constant screen of firepower.

The Matron-class walks the fine line between permissible innovation and forbidden advancement, embodying the spirit of audacity and ambition that drives Tri-Tachyon's quest for technological supremacy.
Fabricates and deploys several defensive drones armed with IR pulse lasers. The drones orbit the ship in a holding pattern.

A midline destroyer from the golden age of the Domain, the Tri-Tachyon refit of the Hammerhead is respected for its staying power in battle as well as its procurement cost compared to other ships of similar size and tech level.

The Stinger Explosives Corporation is a loose-knit and often violent organization of miners, salvage specialists and ex-mercenary gunsels. The collapse of the Gate network left a vacuum in the market for processed metals used in the construction of everything from starships to orbital installments. The corporation was quick to claim the Junk Belt, a region of the Marmara system filled with derelict starships, the remains of orbital factories, and the wrecks of ancient spacecraft. The corporation was able to operate there relatively unmolested by bigger, wealthier entities thanks to the various wars and skirmishes that broke out after the collapse. Hostile takeovers were carried out with explosives and jury-rigged mining vessels, and rival operations were destroyed with underhanded sabotage and ambushes in hyperspace.

The end of the Second AI War saw the arrival of an official peacekeeping force from the Hegemony. The company was quick to switch gears and establish itself as a legitimate salvage and mining firm, but the criminal past of many of its members and its remote location mean the company is looked at with suspicion by its competitors. The sale of illegal munitions, narcotics, and weapons is rumored to still be a significant source of income for the corporation, although the company maintains that it is now fully aboveboard.

The backing of the Hegemony legitimized the company's claim to its territory, making it very difficult to oust the firm by force without sparking a war. The various treaties and agreements between the Tri-Tachyon Corporation and the Hegemony government have kept the corporation safe and allowed it to expand its territory and its influence.

A colossal station built around a sprawling belt of derelict starship wrecks discarded after the Collapse. The Stinger Explosives Corporation operates a shipbreaking operation and salvage yard here. Most hulls are broken down and sold as scrap metal, but there is also a thriving black market for more intact vessels.
text3: The station orbits the local debris field known as the Junk Belt. An array of holoprojectors displays advertisements for the Stinger Explosives Corporation, the local administration overseeing the shipbreaking industry. You can see tugs and other ships at work here and there, pulling wrecks and parts from the Belt, as well as smaller vessels in and out of the repair docks. The occasional security patrol vessel glides by in the distance.

text1: The Ironforge Command station is a former naval logistics base which, after the Collapse, was repurposed into a millitary base to oversee local operations. The local shipbreaking operation was deemed too valuable to be abondoned and instead was subcontracted to a third party, the Stinger Explosives Corporation, who purchased the rights to station administration under their corporate charter. The cost of millitary presence at such a remote site is more than offset by the value of the usable raw materials stripped from the Junk Belt.
text3: An orbital battlestation dominates the scene. The local Hegemony forces operate a millitary base here to provide security to the local shipbreaking operation. The planet is hellishly hot, and its surface is largely volcanic. Pillars of smoke rise from the volcanic, rock-swept terrain below.

text1: An unusally large gas giant with a very strong magnetic field. The planet's interior is liquid with a rocky core. It's surface is composed of liquid methane and hydrogen, and has no solid surface. Three moons orbit the planet in an intricate dance.

This barren planet was once a minor colony world owned by an independent polity, until it was destroyed sometime after the Collapse. It is not known what exactly took place on this planet, but the damage to the surface and surrounding space is so total as to sugges that a large-scale, long-term battle took place.

A barren, rocky planet rich in minerals and one of the three moons of Bursa. A lack of atmosphere, an unusually active molten core, and no natural sources of water mean that Karacabey is inhospitable to organic life. The resources in the planet's crust were deemed to be not worth the cost of establishing a permanent base on the surface and, with the Junk Belt's bounty of scrap, Karacabey was eventually left unattended.

This volcanic, harsh planet orbits the local sun at an unusually small distance. The result is a nightmarishly hot surface. Underground oceans of molten rock bubble and spew lava through volcanoes to form vast deserts of hard basalt.

A dense, dusty atmosphere shrouded by three moons casts a veil of darkness over the surface of this sandy planet. The mining operation set up by the Stinger Explosives Corporation has left scars on the landscape. Pillars of smoke and flame rise into the night sky as refineries process valuable resources from the surrounding quarries.
text3: The occasional explosion from the planet below sends sand and dust into the lower atmosphere. Miners continue their tireless work of excavating the ground and hauling containers filled with ore. The occasional security patrol sweeps the area to guard the refinery and the miners against intruders and pirates.

text1: Widespead ruins cover the surface of the cold grasslands of this planet.  Mescidiye was devastated by a pirate raid not long after the collapse but a population of survivors, bandits, and looters still remains on the fringes of society. A thick layer of smog, caused by industrial pollution long since forgotten, hangs in the atmosphere. Very little sunlight can go past the cloudy blanket. What is able to seep through creates an odd, eerie, white glow that surrounds the planet.

Puffy clouds cast pleasant shadows on the vast oceans of this planet. A handful of artifical platforms are scattered on the surface of the water, forming an arcipelago of sorts. The warm weather, the fresh air and the calming waves make this planet seem like a paradise. Engineered plants from the pre-Collapse era thrive and are cultivated to produce various fruits and vegetables.
text3: The vast waters of this planet are dotted with innumerable platforms floating on the surface. The gentle sound of crashing waves are only interrupted by the occasional shuttle flying above them, ferrying people from platform to platform. The air is fresh and invigorating. The sun sinks into a sea of clouds in the distance, reflecting a beautiful orange hue onto the waters.

text1: The dense atmosphere of this cryovolcanic planet is rich with ammonia. Swirling, violent storms batter the surface and churn the atmosphere. The occasional calmer region provides a temporary respite for the storms to coalesce and spawn lightning strikes.

The remains of the explorarium sporeship have been repurposed into a makeshift dock for shuttles and transports. Shady types in matching armor linger along the edge of the plaza, looking over the shoulders of busy vendors as they hawk their wares to travelers. The Ashbirds, the local cartel controlling the docks, don't appear too concerned about law enforcement.
text3: The remains of the explorarium sporeship have been repurposed into a makeshift dock for shuttles and transports. Shady types in matching armor linger along the edge of the plaza, looking over the shoulders of busy vendors as they hawk their wares to travelers. The Ashbirds, the local cartel controlling the docks, don't appear too concerned about law enforcement.

text1: The nightmarish landscape of this volcanic planet is dotted with ruins of habitat domes and derelict shuttles. Geysers of volatile gas vent from cracks in the crust. Rivers of molten rock flow through the rocky valleys. The thick atmosphere is choked with clouds of ash.

A superheavy gas giant primarily composed of hydrogen and helium gases. The two moons of this planet block most of the natural light from the orange star it orbits. What little heat the star's rays do reach the surface is retained by the planet's metallic clouds, making for an exceptionally dark atmosphere.

A barren planetoid and one of the two moons of the gas giant Kayseri. This planet used to be home to a minor base of operation for the local gas mining operations before it was abandoned after the Collapse.

A barren planetoid and one of the two moons of the gas giant Kayseri. This planet, unlike its sister, is quite insignificant. It has no ore deposits, no valuable minerals and generally nothing worth exploiting.

A ring of ice asteroids orbit this ice giant. A metallic core, formed out of hydrogen and helium, sits at the centre of a dense layer of methane and various ammonia compounds. The thick layer of atmosphere surrounding this planet regularly undergoes a hailstorm of liquid helium.

Cold winds blow through the icy mountains of this planet. Years of skirmishes against pirate raiders have left its landscape littered with the debris of lost battles. Industrial smog blankets the sky and casts a pall of gray over everything.

A radical re-engineering of the humble Mule-class hull that forgoes most modern conveniences and amenities to provide a sturdy, reliable, and heavily armored platform with a large missile payload. The corporation's focus on reliability over performance means the ship does not have the latest electronics or sensor systems but it is cheap, easy to maintain and has an enviable service life.

The Stinger Explosives Corporation fields a variety of civilian hulls that have been re-engineered under the company's 'bulwark doctrine' of ship design. This doctrine was born out of a distrust of modern military technology, particularly the prevalence of Tri-Tachyon's monopoly on more or less all modern military hardware. SEx Co. has focused instead on the development of cheap, reliable and robust ships.

The ever reliable Hound was quickly adopted by the corporation as a combat freighter and modified extensively with extra missile hardpoints. The result is a highly mobile and surprisingly capable frigate, albeit one that does not quite match the power of the proper military frigates in any metric.

The Stinger Explosives Corporation fields a variety of civilian hulls that have been re-engineered under the company's 'bulwark doctrine' of ship design. This doctrine was born out of a distrust of modern military technology, particularly the prevalence of Tri-Tachyon's monopoly on more or less all modern military hardware. SEx Co. has focused instead on the development of cheap, reliable and robust ships.

The ancient Tartarus-class has been in use across the sector for many cycles, even in its original configuration, and the design was quickly seized upon by the corporation as an excellent candidate for conversion into a mining ship. The resulting hybrid is a slow, superheavy frigate that can shrug off enormous amounts of damage.

The Stinger Explosives Corporation fields a variety of civilian hulls that have been re-engineered under the company's 'bulwark doctrine' of ship design. This doctrine was born out of a distrust of modern military technology, particularly the prevalence of Tri-Tachyon's monopoly on more or less all modern military hardware. SEx Co. has focused instead on the development of cheap, reliable and robust ships.

The Ko Combine r450 "Shepherd" has been extensively remodeled by the corporation for their mining operations. The shield projector has been replaced with an archaic damper system and the flight deck has been expanded to field standard mining drones. The ship is known to be a reliable and rugged workhorse and is a staple sight in resource rich asteroid belts.

The Stinger Explosives Corporation fields a variety of civilian hulls that have been re-engineered under the company's 'bulwark doctrine' of ship design. This doctrine was born out of a distrust of modern military technology, particularly the prevalence of Tri-Tachyon's monopoly on more or less all modern military hardware. SEx Co. has focused instead on the development of cheap, reliable and robust ships.

The Whiskey Pete hull was quickly purchased in bulk by the corporation. The base hull, already being a dedicated mining and salvage rig, only needed a few modifications to fit the needs of the company. Addition of small weapon mounts to better fend off pirates and marauders, and the installation of bulky ablative armor plating as per the company's standard doctrine. The result is an imposing, if lumbering, hull that can support mining and salvage operations and survive long enough to bring the wealth back home.

The Stinger Explosives Corporation fields a variety of civilian hulls that have been re-engineered under the company's 'bulwark doctrine' of ship design. This doctrine was born out of a distrust of modern military technology, particularly the prevalence of Tri-Tachyon's monopoly on more or less all modern military hardware. SEx Co. has focused instead on the development of cheap, reliable and robust ships.

The Myriad, a relic from the explosive expansion of the Domain, is an outdated design only fielded by the faithful deacon-captains of the Luddic Church. Still, the sheer flight deck space and raw firepower of the Myriad is unrivaled and its durability has seen a number of private and public militaries seek to re-adopt the Myriad. The corporation, eager to expand their market share, quickly produced a variant as a platform for mining and salvaging operations. The frontal weapon batteries have been replaced with an array of missile launchers and the cargo hold has been expanded to store vast quantities of ore, metals and whatever riches can be found in the depths of space.

The Stinger Explosives Corporation fields a variety of civilian hulls that have been re-engineered under the company's 'bulwark doctrine' of ship design. This doctrine was born out of a distrust of modern military technology, particularly the prevalence of Tri-Tachyon's monopoly on more or less all modern military hardware. SEx Co. has focused instead on the development of cheap, reliable and robust ships.

The Colossus was first adapted for war by Pather militants, but the corporation soon followed their lead. An array of forge-vats have been installed throughout the ship to manufacture mining drones in the field and the hull itself has been expanded to accommodate missile batteries. The result is an imposing and robust mining rig.

The Stinger Explosives Corporation fields a variety of civilian hulls that have been re-engineered under the company's 'bulwark doctrine' of ship design. This doctrine was born out of a distrust of modern military technology, particularly the prevalence of Tri-Tachyon's monopoly on more or less all modern military hardware. SEx Co. has focused instead on the development of cheap, reliable and robust ships.

Tough, dependable and not overly expensive, Venture-class cruisers were quickly adopted into the company's ranks after a large number were bought from the Hegemony-controlled Ko Combine. The missile hardpoints of the ship have been upsized to provide an impressive volume of ordnance and the outdated mining pods have been replaced with more modern SEx Co. designs. The result is a bulky cruiser, capable of laying down a staggering volume of missiles.

The Stinger Explosives Corporation fields a variety of civilian hulls that have been re-engineered under the company's 'bulwark doctrine' of ship design. This doctrine was born out of a distrust of modern military technology, particularly the prevalence of Tri-Tachyon's monopoly on more or less all modern military hardware. SEx Co. has focused instead on the development of cheap, reliable and robust ships.

This variant of the Enforcer-class is a testament to the SEx Co.'s "bulwark doctrine" and was designed to serve as a cheap and capable combat platform. The "Orion Drive" system, being one of the few systems that the corporation can independently manufacture, has been installed to provide unmatched mobility for its class.

The mercenary arm of SEx Co, known as Stingtail Gunsels, field a number of combat ships with radical design philosophies. These vessels are designed to maximize their offensive capability, trading away many amenities and systems in the process. The iconic glitter livery of the Gunsels has become a symbol of recklessness and courage.

The design blueprints of the Eradicator were obtained by the corporation after a daring raid against an independent planet long before the peace accord was signed with the Hegemony. The design was then modified to maximize its potential. The shield projectors were replaced with an accelerated ammo feeder and the "Orion Drive" system, being one of the few systems that the corporation can independently manufacture, has been installed to provide unmatched mobility for its class.

The mercenary arm of SEx Co, known as Stingtail Gunsels, field a number of combat ships with radical design philosophies. These vessels are designed to maximize their offensive capability, trading away many amenities and systems in the process. The iconic glitter livery of the Gunsels has become a symbol of recklessness and courage.

The SEx Co. variant of the Vanguard is a remarkably capable combat frigate. The design was quickly adopted into the Gunsel ranks when shipwrights of the company realized its design was ideal for the company's mercenary force. The ship was cheap, dependable, and was able to hold its own against elite frigates of the time. The hull was quickly fitted with ablative armor, painted with the characteristic glitter livery and pressed into service.

The mercenary arm of SEx Co, known as Stingtail Gunsels, field a number of combat ships with radical design philosophies. These vessels are designed to maximize their offensive capability, trading away many amenities and systems in the process. The iconic glitter livery of the Gunsels has become a symbol of recklessness and courage.

The design blueprints for the Retribution hull were acquired by SEx Co. shortly before the start of the First AI War.  The shipwrights of the time were unsatisfied with the basic design but recognized the immense potential of the "Orion Drive" technology. After a few years and many failed prototypes, the company was able to develop a viable iteration of the Retribution hull with an extensive array of hardpoints and ablative armor. The new design was christened "Padishah", the title of some distant monarch of a forgotten land, a testament to the ship's regal presence and its status as the pinnacle of the company's shipbuilding capabilities.

The mercenary arm of SEx Co, known as Stingtail Gunsels, field a number of combat ships with radical design philosophies. These vessels are designed to maximize their offensive capability, trading away many amenities and systems in the process. The iconic glitter livery of the Gunsels has become a symbol of recklessness and courage.

The Brawler was adopted by the mercenary arm of the corporation to beef up system police forces and port authority security. The removal of the ship's shield projector gave just enough room for the additional missile racks required to upscale the ship's weapon mounts and the shipwrights were able to incorporate the corporation's signature ablative armor into the design. The design is the backbone of the mercenary forces of the company.

The mercenary arm of SEx Co, known as Stingtail Gunsels, field a number of combat ships with radical design philosophies. These vessels are designed to maximize their offensive capability, trading away many amenities and systems in the process. The iconic glitter livery of the Gunsels has become a symbol of recklessness and courage.

A superheavy mining blaster capable of delivering a burst of pulverizing bolts of energy at close range. Desperate mercenaries, miners, and salvage operators have been known to mount this weapon on bulked-up frames to give them a bit more of an edge in their line of work.
Unarmed shuttles used to transfer personnel, supplies, and small cargo as well as assisting larger vessels with navigation.
Various redundancies and reserves allow the ship's energy systems to be briefly pushed beyond its limits.

A heavy weapons package compliments the phase technology built into this ship. An array of redundancies allows the Erubetie to safely overexert its systems and a robust flux grid ensures the weapon systems stay online.
Certain unnerving psychological phenomena have been reported by sensitive crew members after enduring many rapid phase-shifts in combat conditions. Domain Navy reports on the subject were never declassified and are thought to have been lost since the Collapse.

A stealth freighter which audaciously employs phase technology to support covert fleet operations, the Grandine is an unarmed and lightly armored freighter designed to escort the elite raider fleets of the Tri-Tachyon corporation. These fleets were infamously named 'sensor ghosts' as their extensive use of phase technology made them almost invisible to most fleet sensors.

The Grandine, according to reports dating back to the Second AI War, has had issues with entire cargo decks being rearranged in unforeseen ways during phase-shifts with little to no explanation. Shipwrights would blame faulty sensors and admirals would blame lazy spacers. The truth behind these accidents, or even whether these accidents actually happened, are still unknown.

A remnant of the autonomous AI fleets developed by the Tri-Tachyon Corporation. Illegal under Domain (and Hegemony) law, and an abomination to the Church of Galactic Redemption, the First AI War saw these creations purged from the Sector. So the official histories say.

The Amphisbaena was developed as a dedicated carrier platform from which swarms of autonomous fighter craft could be deployed. The design employs gross causality violating technology to rapidly 'pull' any deployed fighters back to the mothership for rearmament, resupply, and redeployment. The lack of any human pilots onboard allows for an unparalleled amount of fighter craft to be deployed by a single warship.

A remnant of the autonomous AI fleets developed by the Tri-Tachyon Corporation. Illegal under Domain (and Hegemony) law, and an abomination to the Church of Galactic Redemption, the First AI War saw these creations purged from the Sector. So the official histories say.

A dedicated missile support platform, the Frederica-class forgoes standard energy armaments in favor of an array of missile mounts and the hardware to support said weapons. Vast internal magazines allow this design to sustain a lengthy barrage of explosive death and destruction.

The Martinet was designed as a reliable and inexpensive destroyer to beef up the naval presence of fringe worlds and small colonies. While its armaments are quite lacking, the Martinet is a sturdy ship, and its cheap price tag and strong armor make it popular among privateers and planetary defense militias. The Church, notably, has been known to outfit these vessels with a variety of religious icons and paraphernalia to serve as escorts for the many pilgrim flotillas that travel throughout the Sector.

An array of semi-autonomous manufacturies sit in low orbit above $market. These fabricators are a testament to the unfathomable industrial might of the Domain. A handful of droneports, scattered throughout the volume, act as distribution hubs for the massive amount of materials and products passing through the system.

A makeshift array of satellites and sensors used to monitor and map hyperspace topography sits in orbit. The Eridani-Utopia Corporation, still clinging to the last remnants of their former glory, use the data gathered here to predict the future movements of slipstreams and hyperspace currents.

This cold, rocky world is home to what remains of the Eridani-Utopia corporation. The company charter bought the administration rights to the planet from the Hegemony shortly after the fall of Qaras, and since then, the survivors have turned the system into a thriving, if somewhat desolate, survey and mining colony.
text3: Rocky outcrops and canyons cover the landscape. What little of humanity's touch remains are the mining and processing operations dotting the horizon. A central city, built into the side of the largest mountain on the planet, is surrounded by the corporate headquarters and private landing pads of the Eridani-Utopia Corporation.

text1:
A remnant of the autonomous AI fleets developed by the Tri-Tachyon Corporation. Illegal under Domain (and Hegemony) law, and an abomination to the Church of Galactic Redemption, the First AI War saw these creations purged from the Sector. So the official histories say.

Conventional fleet dynamics dictate that a number of smaller warships be kept in a fleet for a number of reasons. Their utility, be it for escort or logistic duties, is vital for the survival of the larger capital ships. However, smaller hulls simply do not have the armor, tonnage, and armament potential to match their larger counterparts and are more likely to be destroyed in combat. No logistics chain can support an infinite amount of smaller hulls and the loss of smaller hulls is thus not sustainable. The Broodmother design, in its purest sense, attempts to address this issue by simply building entire frigates during the course of combat. Being autonomous drones with no need for human crew, they can be sacrificed at a rate which no conventional navy can keep up. Any losses can be quickly replaced as long as the autofabs are fed with the raw material needed for such rapid production.

The Broodmother-class represents the epitome of self-reliance and unwavering efficiency. Its silent presence commands both awe and terror, reminding all who encounter it of the fateful conflict that shaped the present state of the sector.
A micro-autofab capable of rapidly producing autonomous frigates during combat. Assembled ships are accelerated out of the assembly bay into combat.
A micro-autofab capable of rapidly producing autonomous frigates during combat. Assembled ships are accelerated out of the assembly bay into combat.
A micro-autofab capable of rapidly producing autonomous frigates during combat. Assembled ships are accelerated out of the assembly bay into combat.

A hybridized mess of a hull that was cobbled together from various salvaged hulls and components. Entire decks are held up with scaffolding and makeshift bulkheads while the superstructure creaks ominously in even the gentlest of accelerations. Several phase coils, ripped from a Doom-class Phase Cruiser, somehow generate a rudimentary phase field and even allow the ship to dive into p-space.
text3:
UNKNOWN ENTRY

Please register your Tri-Tachyon datapad to receive the latest news and updates.

text1: This insane modification of the old Vanguard design, christened Filo by Rosalina who designed it, has no business staying together and certainly has no right to move, but by the grace of Ludd (or the sheer dumb luck of its designer) it somehow manages both. Rosalina's ambitions far exceed her skills as an engineer, which have yet to advance past a basic understanding of what a flux capacitator is, and Filo is the result.
text3:
UNKNOWN ENTRY

Please register your Tri-Tachyon datapad to receive the latest news and updates.

text1: This ship is a monstrosity that would make Ludd faint in horror. This "reimagining" of a Melpomene-class Cruiser takes the original's "Temporal Shell" system to new and disgusting levels of causality violation. In a spark of brilliance, Rosalina has managed to create a self-feeding feedback loop within the system. As the temporal dilation of the system grows, the resulting increase in the flow of entropy through the shell is used to feed the loop, which further increases the temporal dilation and effectively makes time stop around the ship.
text3:
UNKNOWN ENTRY

Please register your Tri-Tachyon datapad to receive the latest news and updates.

text1: The Grande Dame is an improvised ''mothership'' capable of assembling and deploying frigates in combat. Significant hull space is dedicated to an integrated autofab capable of churning out barely spaceworthy frigates. The design is truly an affront to space naval architects, exposed machinery covers much of the ship's outer hull and a series of poorly assembled gun emplacements dot its surface.
text3:
UNKNOWN ENTRY

Please register your Tri-Tachyon datapad to receive the latest news and updates.

text1: An autofab capable of producing frigates during combat. Assembled ships are accelerated out of the assembly bay into combat.

The Catalyst-class destroyer is an unholy amalgamation built around its built-in 'Ship Cracker.' However, the integrated weapon system lacks any safety interlocks and, once activated, will continue firing until the ship inevitably overloads.
text3:
UNKNOWN ENTRY

Please register your Tri-Tachyon datapad to receive the latest news and updates.

text1: A simple attempt to reduce the delay in the phase teleporter system unsurprisingly led to a rabbit hole of unholy experiments, ultimately resulting in the amalgamation now known as the Aphrodite-class frigate.
text3:
UNKNOWN ENTRY

Please register your Tri-Tachyon datapad to receive the latest news and updates.

text1: At first glance, the Puppy-class appears to be an up-gunned variant of the Wolf-class frigate. However, its phase skimmer system has been drastically modified. The resulting system briefly projects a superposition of a seemingly random past (or future) design, which acts independently before vanishing back into P-space.
text3:
UNKNOWN ENTRY

Please register your Tri-Tachyon datapad to receive the latest news and updates.

text1: Once an advanced scientific and military exploration vessel, the Lollipop is now equipped with a massive EMP superarray. While this array boasts an impressive range compared to standard EMP emitters, the eventual feedback from its overcharged capacitors results in a catastrophic acausal failure. The resulting wave overloads not only the host ship but also all ships and fighters in the immediate area.
text3:
UNKNOWN ENTRY

Please register your Tri-Tachyon datapad to receive the latest news and updates.

text1: The ammo feeder system from the classic Martinet-class destroyer has been permanently integrated. Coupled with a wide array of upsized mounts, the newly christened Desperado-class boasts formidable frontal firepowerat least until its overtaxed ammo feeder inevitably fails.
text3:
UNKNOWN ENTRY

Please register your Tri-Tachyon datapad to receive the latest news and updates.

text1: A variant of the Damper Field system that briefly activates an energy field that mitigates incoming damage with no effect on overall ship performance.

"It could work without an interface, yes, but there's no telling what comes out of that autofab. It's got a mind, almost. Like a child. That's the only way I can describe it. It's got a child's mind. We tried to fix some of its quirks, but it just, stopped every time. I think it knows."
text2: - Verbal report from your chief engineer

text1: Significantly speeds up the flow of time on board the ship, effectively stopping time.
"We couldn't find any breakers, can't make it stop once it gets going, no. Takes the whole flux grid out when it happens too. Engines, everything. It's a scramble to get the ship going again."
text2: - Verbal report from your chief engineer

text1: The ship instantly, if a bit inaccurately, teleports to any desired point in space.
text3: The ship instantly teleports to any desired nearby location.

text1: Light, unarmored drones equipped ECM bouncers and little else.

So what if the Gryphon's hull-integrated missile nanoforge can't be loaded fast enough to keep up with the conveyors? Just remove the whole damn thing and use the new-found space for additional missile storage! Does it really matter that the conveyors are straining to keep the missiles loaded in time? It's not like the official reports are going to say anything about it.

A late-Expansion Epoch adaptation of the Swarmer SRM, this long-range missile battery fires salvos of small, guided missiles. Deadly against small craft and unshielded targets. An auxiliary microfab allows this weapon to keep itself supplied in battle.

An artifical I-type supergiant. The lilac hue this star casts on the surrounding system is a testament to its artificial origin. This beating fusion heart bears strong similarities to natural O-type blue supergiants, and it is believed to have been a blue supergiant once. Existence of such stars makes one think of the time before the Collapse, when such wonders were the norm, and the technological ability to toy with suns was not beyond the reach of man, and makes one wonder just what other ancient marvels may yet exist, if only one knew where to look.

The system charges up, releasing an EMP arc over a massive area. Once the capacitors reach full capacity, a supercharged burst from the EMP superarray overloads every ship and fighter in the vicinityincluding itself and any nearby allies.
